msContents.summary: Tax register, recording the daily collection of money taxes in the village of Karanis; the name of each tax-payer is cross-referenced with a page of another register, where taxpayers were listed geographically

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this tax roll (P.Mich. IV/1, 225 + IV/2, 358), its content has been divided in the present database into several cards (one for each column).
Pub. status: Recto; Verso of col. 30 is blank

supportDesc.support: 1 papyrus ; col. 29-30: 34.5 x 29.5 cm; total size: ***

condition.ab: Col. 30: nearly complete (papyrus cut off right of col. 30 when housed in glass)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Phanomgeus son of Petheus and Tamystha grandson of Satabous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Ptolemaios son of Mysthes and Charis grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Petsiris son of Pasoknopaios and Heros grandson of Petsiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)
Kastor son of Mares (Marres) and Soeris grandson of Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Pnepheros son of Pasoxis and Thakiaris (Thakialis) grandson of Petesouchos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Sarapion son of Kames and Thaesis grandson of Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Apitas son of Chairemon and Tasoucharion grandson of Apitas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 152)
Charidemos son of Petoraipis and Thaesis grandson of Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Sabinus son of Petesouchos and Charis grandson of Petesouchos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
Nekpheraus son of Euemeros and Taonnophris grandson of Nekpheraus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 190)
Onnophris son of Petheus and Ptolema grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Ptolemaios son of Petheus and Tapapeis grandson of Sokmenis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Pamoneios (Pamonneouis) son of Anchorimphis and Didymarion grandson of Pamoneios (Pamonneouis) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Petheus son of Ptolemaios and Thermouthis grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Didymos son of Petheus and Eserempis grandson of Heraklas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 161)
Pnepheros son of Pnepheros and Tapetheus grandson of Pnepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Heraklas son of Petheus and Eserempis grandson of Heraklas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 167)
Dioskoros son of Aiaus and Thases grandson of Orsenouphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Horos son of Petaus and Tauris grandson of Petaus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Charmos son of Heron and Apollonous grandson of Horos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Phasis son of Tesenouphis and Thaesis grandson of Harphaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 246)
Maron son of Satabous and Tkonnos grandson of Maron, brother of Menches (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 187)
Menches son of Satabous and Tkonnos grandson of Maron, brother of Maron (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 187)
Petesouchos son of Petheus and Tkollainis grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Patkonnis son of Mysthes and Taonnophris grandson of Patkonnis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 200)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
